alert.note: Alert for Jones; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 9:35AM EST until January 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Kinston affecting Lenoir and Jones Counties. For the Neuse River...including Kinston, Fort Barnwell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Kinston. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water overflows into lowlands adjacent to the river. Water access docks are also affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Monday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EST.
